messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] strewing animals
messages.msgSnippet: We have rats also.  They are very sweet. We had one litter and then  separted male from female.  They love campany, very social.  My guys  are 4 and 12 and
messages.messageBody:
We have rats also. They are very sweet. We had one litter and then separted
male from female. They love campany, very social. My guys are 4 and 12 and
they love them.

Cheryl in Fl


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: strewing animals
messages.msgSnippet: Anywho, just wondering about other experiences with little ones and animals that I hadn t considered. RATS!! Our rattie girls were well loved by all members
messages.messageBody:
"Anywho, just wondering about other experiences with little ones and
animals that I hadn't considered."

RATS!!
Our rattie girls were well loved by all members of the family
(we've now lost all but one of them to old age). They're so smart
and loving, just like a miniature dog or something.
With a wee little one, you do have to be very present while they're
handling them, but even 2y.o. children adore rats and can cuddle and
hold them.
Jalen holds our last little rattie girl all the time. The only
problem is when he leaves her in his bed or in the clean laundry!!
So sweet, but not to be trusted on the chewing or pooping issues.:)

Ren
